Issue	O
Rationale	O
Educação	O
Sociedade	O
&	O
Culturas	O
welcomes	O
articles	O
that	O
bring	O
a	O
vision	O
of	O
possibility	O
in	O
the	O
educational	O
intervention	O
with	O
young	O
people	O
through	O
the	O
arts	O
,	O
in	O
and	O
out	O
of	O
school	O
.	O
Of	O
particular	O
interest	O
are	O
studies	O
that	O
capture	O
promising	O
multidisciplinary	O
experiences	O
in	O
promoting	O
wellbeing	O
and	O
the	O
educational	O
and	O
social	O
inclusion	O
of	O
vulnerable	O
young	O
people	O
.	O
Visual	O
arts	O
,	O
music	O
and	O
drama	O
have	O
proven	O
to	O
be	O
important	O
tools	O
in	O
the	O
teaching-learning	O
processes	O
.	O
If	O
they	O
have	O
a	O
very	O
specific	O
role	O
in	O
themselves	O
by	O
promoting	O
self-expression	O
,	O
creativity	O
and	O
the	O
disciplinary	O
knowledge	O
they	O
imply	O
,	O
arts	O
can	O
also	O
become	O
relevant	O
for	O
educational	O
success	O
,	O
as	O
a	O
pedagogical	O
strategy	O
,	O
by	O
upholding	O
a	O
sense	O
of	O
wellbeing	O
,	O
balance	O
and	O
engagement	O
that	O
help	O
build	O
a	O
disposition	O
to	O
engage	O
with	O
others	O
and	O
learn	O
.	O
This	O
challenge	O
becomes	O
even	O
more	O
complex	O
in	O
contexts	O
where	O
educational	O
institutions	O
work	O
with	O
young	O
people	O
in	O
situations	O
of	O
social	O
vulnerability	O
.	O
There	O
is	O
evidence	O
that	O
there	O
are	O
high	O
levels	O
of	O
suffering	O
among	O
the	O
population	O
attending	O
in-school	O
and	O
out-of-school	O
education	O
